author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A captivating portrayal of the Jazz Age, revealing the emptiness and moral ambiguity beneath the glitz and glamour.

author: Harper Lee
review: An unforgettable exploration of racial injustice and moral growth seen through the eyes of a young girl in the American South.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian vision of a totalitarian regime, exploring the dangers of surveillance, propaganda, and thought control.

author: Jane Austen
review: A timeless romantic comedy of manners, offering keen insight into social norms and the complexities of human relationships.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A poignant exploration of teenage angst and alienation, capturing the disillusionment and vulnerability of adolescence.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An epic fantasy masterpiece, weaving together themes of friendship, courage, and the struggle against darkness.
